description: Date of Image(s) 1/10/25; UTC: 2231091/10/25; UTC: 222449Date of Next Image 1/11/25, 1/14/25Summary: The images are false-color “quick looks” generated from the NASA AVIRIS-3 (Airborne Visible/Infrared Imaging Spectrometer -3). They are generated from un-atmospherically-corrected, at-sensor radiance data. Specifcially: AVIRIS 3 L1B calibrated spectral radiance (units: uW nm-1 cm-2 sr-1). The images have been orthorectified.Given that these images were derived from solely calibrated, at-sensor radiance data, they have not undergone atmospheric correction and do not quantitatively represent surface reflectance. Atmospherically-corrected surface reflectance products will be shared separately when they become available. Suggested Usage: Despite the rawer form of this quick-look product, it is still useful for burned area mapping. Sensor:Airborne Visible/Infrared Imaging Spectrometer 3rd-Generation (AVIRIS-3)AV320250110t223109 Resolution: 3.70 x 3.70 m pixelsDimensions for AV320250110t223109: X: 6210 Y: 3068 Bands: 3AV320250110t222449 Resolution: 3.40 x 3.40 m pixelsDimensions for AV320250110t222449: X: 6593 Y: 3465 Bands: 3The AVIRIS-3 False color RGB wavelengths are 1660nm, 560nm, and 850nm for (R, G, B) respectively)CreditsRob Green (JPL), Phil Brodrick (JPL), David Thompson (JPL), John Chapman (JPL)
title: california_wildfires_202501/aviris3_falsecolor_quicklook
